intro: Zexmenia arnottii subf. gracilis, commonly known as the slender zexmenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal areas. It is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
